ygData.msgSnippet: I have a personal grudge against the new Predacon leader, Hydras. Empath says flatly.  Let s leave it at that. ... though. ... you, ... you, ... straight

"I have a personal grudge against the new Predacon leader, Hydras."  
Empath says flatly.  "Let's leave it at that."

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Ragnar grinned.
> 
> Ragnar: Why, thank you! It is purely the Clan way of thinking, 
though. 
> No waste of ressources. Since you stood there, I assumed you were 
> invited in. Otherwise, I would not have been the first to fire on 
you, 
> quiaff?
> 
> Blackfang, still sitting on a couch, nods.
> 
> Blackfang: He's bright. No wonder you got a command. What about 
you, 
> pred? How come you're here, sympathizing with a bunch of maxies?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > "Oh, you're a funny one."  Empath sits down.  "Most people would 
> have 
> > asked what the hell a Predacon was doing in Maximal headquarters, 
> and 
> > how I knew your name without meeting you before.  You went 
straight 
> > to the argument phase.  I think I'm going to like you."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Ragnar: Neg. I rarely challenge an ally unless they sully my 
> honor. 
> > > From where I come, though, I am an elite warrior and this mech 
I 
> > have 
> > > become is one of the fiercest ever built. I can take two 
Predacons 
> > at 
> > > once.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > Empath::
> > > > 
> > > > "He's right, Ragnar."  Empath points out.  "If you want to 
talk 
> > > > credentials, I can give you an earful.  And if you were 
thinking 
> > of 
> > > > challenging me to one of your silly trials on that point, I 
> > promise 
> > > > you'll be dead before you can land a hit on me."
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > > > > ::Aerotaur::
> > > > >        He eyes Empath cautiously, sizing her up as soon as 
she 
> > > > enters the 
> > > > > room.  He glances at Ragnar.  "She knows of what she 
speaks.  
> > You 
> > > > would be 
> > > > > wise to listen."  He stands up and walks out into the hall 
> > casting 
> > > > a wary 
> > > > > glance at Empath as he passes her.  He slowly makes his way 
> > toward 
> > > > the bridge 
> > > > > hoping to find something to do.
